greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n, k, q) = q*[n=2] + Sum_{j=0..5} q^j*binomial(n-2*j, k-j)*[n>2*j] with T(n,0) = T(n,n) = 1 for q = -4, read by rows.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..50 of the triangle, flattened
formula: T(n, k, q) = q*[n=2] + Sum_{j=0..5} q^j*binomial(n-2*j, k-j)*[n>2*j] with T(n,0) = T(n,n) = 1 for q = -4.
mathematica: T[n_, k_, q_]:= If[k==0 || k==n, 1, q*Boole[n==2] + Sum[q^j*Binomial[n-2*j, k-j]*Boole[n>2*j], {j,0,5}]];
Table[T[n,k,-4], {n,0,12}, {k,0,n}]//Flatten (* modified by _G. C. Greubel_, Apr 27 2021 *)
program: def T(n,k,q): return 1 if (k==0 or k==n) else q*bool(n==2) + sum( q^j*binomial(n-2*j, k-j)*bool(n>2*j) for j in (0..5) )
flatten([[T(n,k,-4) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..12)]) # _G. C. Greubel_, Apr 27 2021
results.author: _Roger L. Bagula_, Feb 10 2010
